intro: Mariscus latibracteatus, commonly known as the broad-bract mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided lobes, and it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Mariscus latibracteatus is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
